types.name: Query
types.description: All of the Pet Library's root query types can be found in the `Query`. This list defines all of the data you can ask for with a query.

fields.name: totalPets
fields.description: This query returns the total number of `Pet`s that are part of the Pet Library.

fields.name: availablePets
fields.description: This query returns the number of `Pet`s that are available for checkout.

fields.name: checkedOutPets
fields.description: This query returns the number of `Pet`s that have been checked out and are not available.

fields.name: allPets
fields.description: This query returns all of the data about the `Pet`s. This is a list of `Pet` objects that are part of the Pet Library.

fields.name: allAvailablePets
fields.description: This query returns data about the `Pet`s who are currently available and not checked out.

fields.name: allCheckedOutPets
fields.description: This query returns data about the `Pet`s who are currently checked out and are not available.

fields.name: petById
fields.description: Use this query to return one `Pet` by ID. If you're not sure what the ID is, send an `allPets` query to find the pet you want to view.

args.name: id
args.description: REQUIRED: Sending an `id` will return a pet that has that ID.

fields.name: familyPets
fields.description: This query returns a list of Family Pets, either a `Cat` or `Dog`.

fields.name: exoticPets
fields.description: This query returns a list of Exotic Pets, either a `Rabbit` or `Stingray`.

fields.name: totalCustomers
fields.description: This query returns the total number of customers that are Pet Library members.

fields.name: allCustomers
fields.description: This query returns all of the data about the customers. This is a list of `Customer` objects that are members of the Pet Library.

fields.name: customersWithPets
fields.description: This query will return a list of all of the customers who currently have pets checked out.

fields.name: me
fields.description: When a `Customer` is logged in and has a valid authorization token, they can send the `me` query to return data about themselves. `me` will return `null` if a `Customer` is not logged in.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Pet
types.description: The Pet Library would not be the Pet Library without a `Pet`. The `Pet` type describes an animal that is part of the pet database. Once a `Pet` has been added to the Pet Library, the pet can be checked in and checked out of the library.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each `Pet`. This value also serves as a lookup for the `petById` query.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The pet's given name

fields.name: weight
fields.description: The weight (in pounds) of the pet in question.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current checkout status of the pet. Must one of the values of the `PetStatus` enumerator: AVAILABLE or CHECKEDOUT.

fields.name: photo
fields.description: A `Photo` type. The `Photo` type is an object containing `thumb` and `full` for thumbnail and fullsize image links.

fields.name: dueDate
fields.description: If this pet is checked out (status: CHECKEDOUT), this field will return a date string describing when the pet is due back. Always return pets on time.

fields.name: inCareOf
fields.description: If this pet is checked out (status: CHECKEDOUT), this field will return the `Customer` who checked this `Pet` out and is responsible for is security and overall happiness.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: PetStatus
types.description: This enumeration type tells us whether or not a pet is checked out. If `AVAILABLE`, a `Customer` can take this pet home. If `CHECKEDOUT`, a `Customer` has to wait for the pet to be returned.

enumValues.name: AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: A `Pet` with this status can be checked out.

enumValues.name: CHECKEDOUT
enumValues.description: A `Pet` with this status has already been checked out and is unavailable.

types.name: Photo
types.description: Each `Pet` has a `Photo`, and this object describes the structure of that `Photo`: a fullsize and thumbnail version of the same `Pet` photo.

fields.name: full
fields.description: The url for a fullsize photo of a `Pet`.

fields.name: thumb
fields.description: The url for a thumbnail photo of a `Pet`.

types.name: Date
types.description: A valid datetime value

types.name: Customer
types.description: Anyone who has created an account at the Pet Library is a `Customer`. Customers can login and checkout/checkin pets to the Pet Library.

fields.name: username
fields.description: A unique username for the `Customer`.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The `Customer`'s name as a string.

fields.name: dateCreated
fields.description: The date that this `Customer` was created (whenever the `createAccount` mutation was sent).

fields.name: currentPets
fields.description: Returns a list of `Pet` objects that the `Customer` currently has checked out. If the `Customer` does not have any pets checked out, this value will be an empty array.

fields.name: checkoutHistory
fields.description: Returns a list of `Checkout`s, objects that describe a pet checkout transaction. If the `Customer` has never checked out a pet, this value will be an empty array.

types.name: Checkout
types.description: Every time a `Pet` is checked out, a record of that `Checkout` is logged. This provides information about the pet, when the pet was checked out and in, and whether or not the pet was late. If you want to find out if a `Customer` is a delinquent, look for the `Checkout` type.

fields.name: pet
fields.description: The entire `Pet` object for the pet who was just checked out.

fields.name: checkOutDate
fields.description: The date that this `Pet` was checked out. This is used to calculate the dueDate.

fields.name: checkInDate
fields.description: The date that this `Pet` was checked out. This is used to calculate the dueDate.

fields.name: late
fields.description: A boolean flag to indicate whether the `Pet` was checked in late. If this value is true, this means that you blocked another person from checking out a `Pet`. You can do better than that.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: FamilyPet
types.description: `FamilyPet` is a union type which means that either a `Cat` or `Dog` could be returned for each `FamilyPet`.

types.name: Cat
types.description: A `Cat` is a small, carnivorous mammal who is usually sleeping.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each `Cat`.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The cat's given name

fields.name: weight
fields.description: The weight (in pounds) of the cat in question.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current checkout status of the cat. Must one of the values of the `PetStatus` enumerator: AVAILABLE or CHECKEDOUT.

fields.name: photo
fields.description: A `Photo` type. The `Photo` type is an object containing `thumb` and `full` for thumbnail and fullsize image links.

fields.name: dueDate
fields.description: If this cat is checked out (status: CHECKEDOUT), this field will return a date string describing when the cat is due back. Always return cats on time.

fields.name: inCareOf
fields.description: If this pet is checked out (status: CHECKEDOUT), this field will return the `Customer` who checked this `Cat` out and is responsible for is security and overall happiness.

fields.name: sleepAmount
fields.description: The number of hours a cat sleeps per day.

fields.name: curious
fields.description: A Boolean describing whether or not this `Cat` is curious. This is almost always `true`.

types.name: Dog
types.description: A `Dog` is a wolf descendant that you can dress in a little jacket.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each `Dog`.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The dog's given name.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: The weight (in pounds) of the dog in question.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current checkout status of the dog. Must one of the values of the `PetStatus` enumerator: AVAILABLE or CHECKEDOUT.

fields.name: photo
fields.description: A `Photo` type. The `Photo` type is an object containing `thumb` and `full` for thumbnail and fullsize image links.

fields.name: dueDate
fields.description: If this dog is checked out (status: CHECKEDOUT), this field will return a date string describing when the dog is due back. Always return dogs on time.

fields.name: inCareOf
fields.description: If this dog is checked out (status: CHECKEDOUT), this field will return the `Customer` who checked this `Dog` out and is responsible for is security and overall happiness.

fields.name: good
fields.description: A Boolean describing whether or not this `Dog` is a good dog. This is almost always `true`.

types.name: ExoticPet
types.description: `ExoticPet` is a union type which means that either a `Rabbit` or `Stingray` could be returned for each `ExoticPet`.

types.name: Rabbit
types.description: A `Rabbit` hops and flops around.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each `Rabbit`.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The rabbit's given name.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: The weight (in pounds) of the rabbit in question.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current checkout status of the rabbit. Must one of the values of the `PetStatus` enumerator: AVAILABLE or CHECKEDOUT.

fields.name: photo
fields.description: A `Photo` type. The `Photo` type is an object containing `thumb` and `full` for thumbnail and fullsize image links.

fields.name: dueDate
fields.description: If this rabbit is checked out (status: CHECKEDOUT), this field will return a date string describing when the rabbit is due back. Always return rabbits on time.

fields.name: inCareOf
fields.description: If this rabbit is checked out (status: CHECKEDOUT), this field will return the `Customer` who checked this `Rabbit` out and is responsible for is security and overall happiness.

fields.name: favoriteFood
fields.description: This field will describe the favorite food of this particular rabbit. Don't assume it's always carrots. Rabbits contain multitudes.

fields.name: floppy
fields.description: This field describes, on a scale of 1-10 how floppy this particular rabbit is.

types.name: Stingray
types.description: A `Stingray` is a cartilaginous fish related to sharks common to coastal tropical and subtropical waters that the Pet Library will let you take home for some reason.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each `Stingray`.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The stingray's given name.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: The weight (in pounds) of the stingray in question.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current checkout status of the stingray. Must one of the values of the `PetStatus` enumerator: AVAILABLE or CHECKEDOUT.

fields.name: photo
fields.description: A `Photo` type. The `Photo` type is an object containing `thumb` and `full` for thumbnail and fullsize image links.

fields.name: dueDate
fields.description: If this stingray is checked out (status: CHECKEDOUT), this field will return a date string describing when the stingray is due back. Always return stingrays on time.

fields.name: inCareOf
fields.description: If this stingray is checked out (status: CHECKEDOUT), this field will return the `Customer` who checked this `Stingray` out and is responsible for is security and overall happiness

fields.name: chill
fields.description: Is this stingray chill? This will tell you how chill on a scale of 1 (least chill) - 10 (most chill).

fields.name: fast
fields.description: Is this stingray fast? If so, this field will return `true`.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: All of the Pet Library's root mutation types can be found in the `Mutation`. Any types of data changes you want to make can be found here.

fields.name: createAccount
fields.description: When you need to create an account at the Pet Library, you'll need to send this mutation. Your name + username + password is all you need to be given dominion over cats, dogs, rabbits, and/or stingrays.

fields.name: logIn
fields.description: A mutation used to log in a registered user. If you haven't created an account yet, start with the `createAccount` mutation.

args.name: username
args.description: REQUIRED: Send your unique `username` as an argument to log in

args.name: password
args.description: REQUIRED: Send your `password` as an argument to log in

fields.name: checkOut
fields.description: A mutation used to check out a `Pet`. Once you check out a `Pet`, that pet is in your care, even the stingrays.

args.name: id
args.description: This id will be used to locate the `Pet` and check them out.

fields.name: checkIn
fields.description: A mutation used to check a `Pet` back in to the Pet Library.

args.name: id
args.description: This id will be used to locate the `Pet` and check them out.

types.name: CreateAccountInput
types.description: When a user creates an account, they must send `name`, `username`, and `password` to the `createAccount` mutation. This input type wraps those fields into one fancy object.

types.name: LogInPayload
types.description: When a `Customer` logs in to the Pet Library, they can get their token and customer information from the `LogInPayload` type. This is how user authentication is handled at the library.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The entire `Customer` object for the recently logged in individual.

fields.name: token
fields.description: The authorization token that can be used to run queries and mutations that require login.

types.name: CheckOutPayload
types.description: Checking out a `Pet` is a dream come true for many people. Receiving `customer`, `pet`, and `checkoutDate` back as an object from the `checkOut` mutation is a dream come true for a pet librarian and a GraphQL enthusiast.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The entire `Customer` object for the customer who just checked out a pet.

fields.name: pet
fields.description: The entire `Pet` object for the pet who was just checked out.

fields.name: checkOutDate
fields.description: The date that this `Pet` was checked out. This is used to calculate the due date.

types.name: CreateAccountPayload
types.description: When a new customer creates an account, this object will be returned from the `createAccount` mutation.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The entire `Customer` object for the recently registered individual.

fields.name: message
fields.description: A welcome message to the new `Customer` encouraging them to log in.

types.name: Upload
types.description: The `Upload` scalar type represents a file upload.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

directives.name: client
directives.description: Direct the client to resolve this field locally, either from the cache or local resolvers.

args.name: always
args.description:
When true, the client will never use the cache for this value. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#forcing-resolvers-with-clientalways-true

directives.name: export
directives.description:
Export this locally resolved field as a variable to be used in the remainder of this query. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#using-client-fields-as-variables

args.name: as
args.description: The variable name to export this field as.

directives.name: connection
directives.description:
Specify a custom store key for this result. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/advanced/caching/#the-connection-directive

args.name: filter
args.description: An array of query argument names to include in the generated custom store key.
